output_list.reason: The function `sub` in the `Virgo_ZodiacToken` contract has no checks for signed integer overflow. This can be exploited by transferring a large amount of tokens to an address and then trying to transfer more, which will cause an integer overflow and revert the transaction. This can be mitigated by adding checks in the `sub` function to see if the result of the subtraction will cause an overflow.

The function `enablePurchasing` in the `Virgo_ZodiacToken` contract only has one line of code to set the purchasing status. This can be exploited by calling this function multiple times until the purchasing status becomes true. This can be mitigated by adding a delay or a counter check in the `enablePurchasing` function to prevent this.

The function `setAIRDROPBounce`, `setICORatio`, and `setMINfinney` in the `Virgo_ZodiacToken` contract use the `msg.sender` as the seed for the random number generator. This can be exploited by calling these functions with the same seed to get the same result. This can be mitigated by using a more secure random number generator, such as the `random` library.

The function `burn` in the `Virgo_ZodiacToken` contract is only accessible to the contract owner. This can be exploited by calling this function with a different account that has enough balance to burn tokens. This can be mitigated by adding a modifier to the `burn` function to only allow the contract owner to call it.
There is no typo constructor in this smart contract.
